sentences.english: It's the glorious duty for every soldier to defend our country against enemies.
sentences.chinese: 卫国抗敌是每个士兵应尽的光荣职责。

sentences.english: Some glorious morn--but when? Ah, who shall say?
sentences.chinese: 光荣的黎明，谁能说何时出现？

sentences.english: The honour of finally appearing for his country means more to the player than the name of the opponents.
sentences.chinese: 能够为祖国效力对球员来说意味着无尚的光荣。

sentences.english: He was a glory of his profession.
sentences.chinese: 他是他那个行业的光荣。

sentences.english: The story about the six-storeyed dormitory tells a glorious history.
sentences.chinese: 关于六层楼宿舍的故事讲述一段光荣历史。

sentences.english: The new Committee, as an advisory body to the governments of the two countries, has a great responsibility and an honorable mission.
sentences.chinese: 新一届委员会责任重大，使命光荣。

sentences.english: The Red Army's glorious revolutionary traditions have carried over to the present day.
sentences.chinese: 红军的光荣革命传统一直发扬到今天。

sentences.english: It's better to die with hornor than to live in infamy .
sentences.chinese: 与其苟且偷生不如光荣而死。

sentences.english: The story about the six-storey dormitory tells a glorious history.
sentences.chinese: 关于六层楼宿舍的故事讲述一段光荣历史。

sentences.english: These two party names originated with the Glorious Revolution(1688).
sentences.chinese: 这两个政党名称皆起源于1688年的光荣革命。

sentences.english: Okuni as a character in the Koei video game Samurai Warriors.
sentences.chinese: 阿国是光荣公司的电子游戏《战国无双》中的角色。

sentences.english: No road of flowers lead to glory. ( La Fontaine )
sentences.chinese: 有一条通向光荣的道路是铺满鲜花的。

sentences.english: Since 1954, forty names have been retired.
sentences.chinese: 从1954年一来，光荣退役的名字有40个。

sentences.english: And in the glory there my Great Reward.
sentences.chinese: 在那光荣里，有我伟大的酬报。

sentences.english: His reputation was blemished by a newspaper article alleging he had taken bribes.
sentences.chinese: 报纸上一篇文章说他纳贿，他的光荣以是遭到玷污。

sentences.english: Poverty is no shame, laziness is.
sentences.chinese: 贫穷不怕羞，疏懒才光荣。

definition: to regard it as an honor (idiom)
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
